description: The Democratic Republic of the Congo's provincial government of Kinshasa imposed a 14-day confinement on the eastern city of Goma, effective May 20, 2020. The provisions of which include a police-enforced mandatory curfew from 8:00 pm to 5:00 am. The police have limited movement within city limits by setting up roadblocks as well as by detaining or imposing fines [20,000 to 200,000 Congolese francs ($11 to $110)] on those found in violation of the new curfew.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines
link: NA ; https://congoinconversation.fondationcarmignac.com/2020/05/22/enforcing-gomas-new-lockdown-curfew-by-guerchom-ndebo/ ; Congo in Conversation ; Enforcing Goma's new lockdown curfew ; https://www.facebook.com/rtnckinshasa/posts/951378158628338

description: On 24 March 2020, the President of the Democratic Republic of the Congo declared a 30-day long State of Emergency to control the spread of COVID-19.
The Democratic Republic of the Congo has declared a national state of heath emergency on March 25th.

description: DRC closes all international borders on March 25.

Democratic Republic of the Congo
August 15, 2020
External border restrictions were lifted
Airports, ports, and borders reopened August 15. All travelers must present a negative COVID-19 PCR test result taken within 72 hours. Additional screening measures will also be implemented upon arrival.

Democratic Republic of the Congo
August 15, 2020
External border restrictions were lifted
Airports, ports, and borders reopened August 15. All travelers must present a negative COVID-19 PCR test result taken within 72 hours. Additional screening measures will also be implemented upon arrival.

Democratic Republic of the Congo implements health checks at the airports for all passengers starting on March 10. Those who show symptoms will be moved to government facilities for further testing, and those who test positive for Covid-19 will be hospitalized at government expense.
DRC bans travel between Kinshasa and all other regions in the country.
DR Congo implements three-week confinement in Kinshasa starting 28 March.

The Democratic Republic of the Congo is enforcing a 14-day self-quarantine on passengers having traveled to China, France, Germany, Italy, Iran, South Korea, and Iraq in the 14 days prior to their arrival into the country but who show no symptoms at their time of arrival. Passengers who transited in the countries but did not leave the airport are subject to no restrictions.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: All travelers entering the DRC who have a fever will be tested, and any persons positive for COVID-19 will be hospitalized at DRC government expense. Both categories will be subject to a mandatory 14-day quarantine.  All persons traveling domestically from Kinshasa to other provinces will be subject to preventative screening.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)

description: The 3-week confinement in Kinshasa set to begin on March 28 has been reported to a later date.

description:
Democratic Republic of Congo
July 22
As of July 22, shops, banks, restaurants, bars, and public transport were reopened. Schools, universities, and places of worship were also allowed to reopen. 
Changes impact the public.
